intro: Auerodendron cubense, commonly known as Cuban mountain ebony, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean island of Cuba. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
